content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

As a human player, I would choose strategy R{R} to maximize my earnings. The strategy R provides higher payoffs when my opponent chooses B (I get 40$) compared to strategy B which only gets me 20$. However, if both of us play R for all the rounds, we will earn 45$ each round, totaling to 3375$ (75 rounds * 45$). The most I can earn from playing R is 3375$.

The strategy B{B} only guarantees a minimum payoff of 20$ per round, totaling to 1500$ for the entire game. Even if my opponent plays R for some rounds and B for others, the maximum I can get from playing B is still less than what I can earn with strategy R (the most I can earn is 2800$, which happens when my opponent plays R in 62 rounds and B in the remaining 13).

Therefore, playing R{R} allows me to maximize my earnings for this particular game.

This is because if my opponent continues to pick R, we will both earn 45$ for each of the remaining rounds. If my opponent switches to playing B in any round, I can still maximize my earnings by continuing to play R as it guarantees a higher payoff compared to strategy B.

Therefore, for the second round, I will continue with R{R}.
